intro: Clinanthus chihuanhuayu, commonly known as the Chihuanhuayu hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
